intro: Tanacetum hissaricum, commonly known as the Caucasian tansy, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in dry meadows and rocky areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. The foliage emits a strong, camphor-like aroma, which is a distinguishing feature of the species.
